abstract: Developments in Greece helped stocks in the United States, closing a volatile quarter marked by debt concerns in the euro zone and by a struggling economic recovery at home.
snippet: Developments in Greece helped stocks in the United States, closing a volatile quarter marked by debt concerns in the euro zone and by a struggling economic recovery at home.
lead_paragraph: Stock prices rose sharply on Thursday as easing concerns over European debt troubles and economic growth in the United States helped the Dow Jones industrial average end the second quarter with a modest gain.

headline.main: Dow Gains 153 Points to End the Quarter Higher
headline.print_headline: Dow Gains 153 Points to End the Quarter Higher
